turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: Well, Miss Henried, what a coincidence. You're just in time fer a case that seems ta concern you. Guess you didn't care about the other proceedin's we been dealin' with here this mornin'.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I'm sorry. I was...busy. In the lab.

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: Well, you managed ta make it here jus' in time fer this case, didn't ya?

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: Miss Henried, I think you better...

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: ...Captain Rhodes is trying to...

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: MISS HENRIED, SHUT THE HELL UP!!!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Sir. It's quite clear that...

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: SHUT UP, MISS HENRIED! I TOL' YA B'FORE!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: THIS IS A TRAVESTY! CAPTAIN RHODES IS...

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: SIDDOWN, YOUNG LADY! I DONE YUP A SHIT-LOAD O' FAVOURS AND I AIN'T NEVER YET ASKED FER NOTHIN' IN RETURN! NOW HOW'D YOU LIKE TA SPEND TWO WEEKS UP T'THE VEGETABLE FARM YERSELF? THAT'S WHAT IT'LL BE IF YA DON'T SIDDOWN AN' SHUT THE HELL UP!

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: Now I think Captain's punishment is fair, considerin'. In fact I think you ain't got shit ta complain about.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I'm sorry, General, if I...spoke out of turn. It's just that...Mr Tyler is not here to defend himself. He has no representation. I don't believe due process is being served by...

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: Listen, Missy. I am the only due process that has ta be served aroun' tyere and one of the people doin' the servin' from now on is gonna be you. Now you been prancin' aroun' the Cave like yer ass was glass fer long enough! All that's

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: gonna change, young lady. Now if you still got a statement you'd like ta make, you can jus' hold onto it 'til tonight.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Tonight?

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: That's right. 'Bout eight, if that suits. We'll start out in my gymnasium an' progress on from there...to various other forms o' physical therapy.

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: The great state of Florida. People came here fer years ta die. Retire and expire. The rest o' the country used ta think we was nothin' but a bunch o' farts and fogies. Hah! Now this here's the new Capital o' the World! Hah! They came here...died...went to hell...and the Devil sent 'em back as an army. Hah! General Gasparilla's army...MY ARMY!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: We think there are other cities surviving. We think maybe Detroit... there's some signalling out of Philly.

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: There's no place like this place. Warm climate. This facility. Christ, there ain't nothin' like this no-damn-where! Even the Feds knew that. That's why they stored so much o' their shit down here. It's all mine now. All mine. Just let 'em try ta come after us down here, which they will some day...take a likin' ta what all we got an' come after us. They'll hafta get past my army! An army that ain't afraid ta die...ha ha ha...'cause it's awreddy DAID! HA HA HA HA....

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: It's not a very big army. And small as it is you won't be able to continue feeding it for very long. We've got to find ways of getting them to respond without relying on...

turns.speaker: GASPARILLA
turns.text: You'll find the ways, Miss Mary. And when ya do...we'll sail on over to the mainland...or any other damn mainland fer that matter...and start us a recruitin' program. There's millions o' Bees out there jus' waitin' fer' a General ta lead 'em on ta vict'ry!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Bees. That's what we call the dead... the walking dead...here on Gasparilla's island.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Gasparilla?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: He was a pirate who sailed these waters long ago. His name is bein' borrowed these days by the long lost Henry Dickerson.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Governor Dickerson? Of Florida?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's the man. He's been holed up here ever since the shit hit the fan. Him and his family owned these islands 'round here. They was leasin' this one to the Fed. The whole underneath is dug out. There was missiles here and laboratories and bomb proof housing, nuclear power, all o' that. Now this is Dickerson's....Gasparilla's... private fortress. Him and a bunch o' his cronies from all the best golf courses in Tallahassee...and his private army, of course.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: We ran up against a platoon of soldiers. There were actually walking dead...in uniform...with guns.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Captain Rhodes and his Red Coat Bees. They could sting, sister. We know you came up against 'em. We been watchin' you since you landed. Couldn't help. I'm sorry for that. We ain't supposed to be outside. If we was spotted it could....well, it could be the end of everything.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Thanks. I can fight my own battles.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I know you can. Like I said, we been watchin' you.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: The man I was with...until today... believed that praying was for blind men who couldn't see the truth.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: How we gonna break the curse without a prayer or two.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Curse?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What is it if it ain't a curse?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: It's a disease. It's a...a bug...a parasite that infects the brain.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That sounds like a curse to me.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: We thought we were escaping here. We thought we'd found an uninhabited island. Christ! This place is a worse nightmare than anything I've seen yet!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm sure that's true, miss. And that's why we're doin' what we're doin'. What's happenin' underground here is just what Lucifer planned for this sinful race o' man. But we're gonna beat Lucifer. We're gonna put an end to what's happenin' here.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Oh, what did I run into? A bunch o' Jesus nuts? Religiosos? Prayer won't stop a bullet from one of those storm troopers and prayer won't keep one of those monsters from eatin' your liver for lunch.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's why we didn't use prayers on this here white coat 'til after he was destroyed. We ready to fight when we have to. And we gotta fight now.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Look. I BEEN fightin', mister. I been fightin' for what feels like a hundred years and I'm finished. I don't need religion. I don't need prayers. I need a couple guns and a couple hands. We can sail on outa here. Find another island where there ain't so much....traffic.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You think you can find your boat? There's a thousand little inlets and backwaters all through here. You remember all the ways you turned to get where you are now? You leave yourself a trail?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I can find it myself. I didn't come that far.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Farther than you think. You'll get lost. You will. And there's Bees all through the jungle. I ain't lyin' to ya. Religiosos don't lie.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: No. They just try to hold you for ransom. Fuck you, Moses! I'm outa here!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: They seem to be havin' a good time. Some punishment.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You disappear in here, darlin'. You get a knife in yer belly or too much shit in yer veins. You get lost out here and nobody's gonna notice. Rhodes, he counts on that. It all makes for food in the freezers.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Let me go! I'm the one he wants. This is all happening because of me. If I turn myself in...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: He's just finding another reason for bumpin' us off. Don't ya see. He needs us ta die. He needs our bodies.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Toby's right. They're not gonna sit around with their fingers up their asses while we bust up their toys.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Datura.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Datura Metel. The Devil's Trumpet. Don't worry. I ain't goin' religioso again. It's a flower that grows on these islands. Where I come from the voodoo priests used it whenever they needed a Mickey Finn. It's toxic. Ground up you can put it in a drink or inject it...or...in a sealed area it might be introduced through the ventilation system.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Datura! Miguel knew it! Datura, he was shouting! Datura Metel!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We always planned to use it. We got some ground up already...but we could never find enough.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: There's hundreds of 'em. Right where we landed our boat.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Looks like just two. We can take 'em when the time comes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We're only about a quarter-mile from Cave entrance number five.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: It's...he was...one who came to the island with me.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: How long do we have to watch him?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Forever, darlin'. Forever. 'Til he turns ta dust and blows away on the wind.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: It's alright. I'm a friend. I need help and so do you. What's a safe place to talk?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Ain't no place safe.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Look...I know you have no reason to trust me. I've got friends in the Cave. I got some stuff comin' out this mornin'. I'm gonna try to get off the island.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I'm gonna have this stuff sent over to the hospital...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: The hospital?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Yeah. My stuff's all marked with red crosses so nobody gets too nosey. Meet me at the hospital after the supplies come in. Maybe we can find a place there to talk.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What'dya tell that soldier, soldier? You tell him we was rebels?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: He's my contact for Chrissake! There's two crates. Can you get me into the hospital?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: There ya go. Complete with air canisters...little motors.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We got a boat.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I say we got a boat. Can you get other stuff?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I got some fuel comin' out and, I hope, some automatic rifles.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: It won't work. That's pure nitro you're dealin' with there. That stuff can blow if you look at is funny. What're you gonna do, walk into the Cave carryin' those tubes on feather pillows? You don't have a complete layout of the place. Even if you manage to avoid a fight you won't know where to go.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We're hopin' you can show us where ta go, Toby.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Oh, no. I'm tryin' to get off this island alive. I'll help you all I can but I'm not goin' in there on a suicide mission. What can you hope to accomplish? Some radios maybe? A supply room or two? You'll all be killed and in a few weeks they'll be back to business as usual. That place was built to withstand nuclear attack! What are you gonna do with a half-dozen guns and a few sticks of nitro?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We're gonna blow up the powder magazine.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We know what's down there. We did the loading' and unloadin' when the stuff came ashore in the early days. A direct hit oughta do more than a few weeks worth o' damage.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: A direct hit'll blow the top off this whole island! How're you gonna fuse the stuff? How're you gonna leave yourself time to get out?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: This stuff really works? No shit?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Quicker than gas. And it smells a lot prettier. It usually don't kill but it puts ya under fer a good night's sleep.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: If you could knock out the central communications room you could foul up their whole intercom system. Then, if you move fast enough, stay ahead of 'em...without bein' able to signal each other, they might have a hard time catchin' you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I say it's poetic. Pure calypso, brother. The Devil's Trumpet blowin' the notes o' doom for the Devil's troops. Ha ha ha ha ha...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: That entrance is closest to the labs and the Bee cages.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Come on. Let's go.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: That's the general alarm. Jesus! They musta got in!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What you wanna do?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I didn't realise! Those were de-caps! I didn't know that....de-caps... revived!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Any dead whose brains are intact will revive.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: But...we bury the heads. Oh. God! It must be torture for them!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: They are brutes without feeling. Though I admit that I've requested cremation for myself. Burial is an archaic tradition, even more ridiculous now than it ever was. To say nothing of the...spacing problem...on a small island like this.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I thought the purpose of decapitation was to...to...

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: The purpose of decapitation is to preserve as much...food...as possible. The purpose for feeding is to keep the beasts on our side. The fact that they can be taught to clean up our garbage or to fire a gun is a convenient side benefit, not the primary goal. The primary goal is to keep ourselves from becoming their supper. Keep them fed and they behave. Keep them hungry and they revert back to being the animals that they have always been. You saw them in there.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: He is dying. He knows it.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: You are dying, too.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: No. The disease was cut away from me. I will live. I will live.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Prayers have no power to save. The knife can save. It can cut the disease away. The bullet. It can shatter the brain where the evil takes seed. These are saviours...our new saviours...our only saviours.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: We must wait. One day the curse will pass. One day a dead man will... will...

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: One day a dead man will refuse to return, and that man will be a saint. The first saint of our century. That's a prayer, too. A catechism. Something the priests tell us to believe.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: You can believe this, Miguel. I'll kill you if you shoot. We must wait. I'll....I'll do it....I'll do it myself....when it needs to be done.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: No. You won't be able to do it. He will rise. He will rise and you... you will die.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Dios mia.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: I tol' him. I tol' him this is a dead place. Like all the others.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: TONY....TONY....

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: PULL IN! GET THE OTHERS.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Aaaaaaah...my God...my God...I am heartily sorry...for having offended Thee....offended Thee...

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Shhhhh....Tony. Rest, rest.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: I detest all my sins...because... because of Thy just punishment... because of Thy...just...punish...

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: NOOOOOOOOO!

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: ...but most of all because...they offend Thee, my God...Who art all good...and deserving...deserving of all my love...

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Come, come, Miss Science. You've seen worse.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: God....damn you, Rhodes!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: God has damned us all. Are my atrocities worse than yours?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You have ruined weeks of work here! We've been trying to wean these specimens onto alligator meat!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: No wonder they're so....hungry.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You gave them a fresh taste of blood!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: They will never be satisfied with anything else, Miss Henried. They want human flesh. I'm prepared to take whatever steps are necessary to see to it they don't get mine! Not while I'm still using it!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: You can't run away from the planet, Miss Science. You can't even run away from the island, heh heh.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Leave me alone, you...COCKSUCKER!!!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You're....you're disgusting! You're....FILTH!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: And you're the one who builds the bomb and they says, 'I hope it'll never actually be used'.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Julie Grant is a behaviouralist. She's not medical. She hasn't been as...exposed to...to things...as some of the rest of us. She'll be alright. I'll talk to her. She'll be alright.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Oh, I have no doubt.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: If you put her on the shit list because of her reaction here tonight I'll go to Dickerson.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Ah, yes, our noble Gasparilla does seem to favour you lately. I understand he assigned you a roommate of your choice. The rest of us have to pick names out of a hat.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Rhodes, you and I had a roll in the hay together when I first got here. It was a wholly unsatisfying experience which I do not want to, and which I never will repeat! So give up, mister! I'm going home...to that roommate you mentioned.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: I had an unfortunate little run-in with him today. In fact...you might say that Mr. Tyler is in big trouble with the...authorities.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You better not mess with me, Rhodes. I'd love to serve your balls to those Red Coats for lunch! Think about it!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: No, Miss Science. You're the one who needs to do some thinking.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Sir. In the matter of the State versus Private Tyler, I don't want to...

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Sir, Tyler is innocent of any crime against the State. Captain Rhodes is...

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Toby...thank God...wait here. I gotta find out what's goin' on.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Hey. Slow down. What is it?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Some of Rhodes' men. At the door.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: That bastard. I didn't think he'd make his move so fast.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: It's because of me.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Oh, bullshit, Mary. It's because Rhodes is a prick.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I want you to leave. Then maybe...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: We're both gonna leave. Leave the island. I've been talkin' to Tricks. We think we can smuggle out one of those inflatable rafts. They're crated up real small. They've got air canisters. There's food inside. Even a little motor.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I am not...a guerilla fighter, Toby. I'm not a pioneer. I'm not...I'm not strong that way. I need...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Need what? Civilised order like we have down here? Christ!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I can work here. Maybe my work can help...help everyone. I can do more good with access to this equipment than I can off in some wasteland.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: For the good of mankind. That's what every monster-maker says.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Mary.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I'll have somebody's ass for this. I'll have your ass, soldier. I'm not gonna stand here and...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: MARY!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Where are you going, Tyler?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: My..."detail", sir. We're going to bury the heads.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: No time for that. I'll take care of them.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Just....following procedure, sir. They're entitled to burial.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: I said, I'll take care of them. Just leave them there. Go help with the rest of the gear.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Step up here, Tyler.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Sir!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: You fired that shot, didn't you?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Let me see your weapon.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: It's been fired.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: In the battle, sir.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Hey, Tricks. Some detail they got you on.

turns.speaker: TRICKS
turns.text: Not as bad as yours, pal.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: What'dya get?

turns.speaker: TRICKS
turns.text: Rafts. Two 38s. A little ammo.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: We need fuel, and a couple automatics.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Tricks...Jesus...

turns.speaker: TRICKS
turns.text: I'm alright. Let's go.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: No relation.  Never heard of him. Sorry.

turns.speaker: BUBBA
turns.text: Say Steve, where's your manners?  Here's Mutt's brother and you don't offer him a drink? Want some bourbon?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Actually I don't

turns.speaker: BUBBA
turns.text: So what the hell's Mutt been up to?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Actually I don't really know Mutt.

turns.speaker: BUBBA
turns.text: To fucking Mutt.

turns.speaker: BUBBA
turns.text: Well, I'd better find Patsy.  Say hello to Mutt for me.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Will do.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Sounds boring to me.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Don't come.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You know how many demerits we're talking?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So don't goddam come!  Please.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: All I'm saying is we have to be careful. We can't get caught.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well, no shit, Sherlock

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: I'm in as long as we're careful.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Knox?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Do they go to Henley Hall?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I don't think they're in school.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: They're townies?!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Cameron, what is the matter with you. You act like they're your mother or something.  You afraid of them?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Hell no, I'm not afraid of them just, if we get caught with them, we're dead.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Charlie Dalton.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Knox Overstreet.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Why doesn't he let you do what you want?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Yeah!  Tell him off!  It couldn't get any worse.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How was dinner?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Terrible.  Awful!  I met the most beautiful girl I've ever seen in my life!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Thigh man?  Mr. "K" was a hell raiser.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: What is the Dead Poets Society?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: I don't know.  I don't get it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Come on.  It'll help you get Chris.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: It will?  How do you figure?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Women swoon!

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: But why?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: The millions are awake enough for Physical labor; but only one in a million is awake enough for effective intellectual exertion, only one in a hundred millions to a poetic or divine life.  To be awake is to be alive.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Hey, this is great.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I feel like I've never been alive.  For years I've been risking nothing.  I have no idea what I am or what I want to do! Neil, you know you want to act.  Knox wants Chris.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Needs Chris!  Must have Chris!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Meeks, you're the brain here.  What do the dead poets say about somebody like me?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: God, I can't take it anymore!  If I don't have Chris, I'll kill myself.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Knox, you gotta calm down.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: No, I've been calm all my life!  If I don't do something, it's gonna kill me.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Can you believe it?  She was gonna call me!  She invited me to a party with her!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: At Chet Danburry's house.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So you really think she means you're going with her?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Well hell no, Charlie, but that's not the point.  That's not the point at all!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What is the point?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: The point is she was thinking about me! I've only met her once and already she's thinking about me.  Damn it, it's gonna happen!  I feel it.  She's going to be mine!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How'd it go?  Did you read it to her?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What do you mean you don't know?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: I'll tell you later.

turns.speaker: MEEKS
turns.text: Well, welcome to "Hell"ton.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's every bit as hard as they say. Unless you're a genius like Meeks.

turns.speaker: MEEKS
turns.text: He flatters me so I'll help him with Latin.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: And English, and trig

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh come on, Cameron, don't you get anything?

turns.speaker: MEEKS
turns.text: How about a trig study group?  Right after dinner.

turns.speaker: MEEKS
turns.text: All right.  I'll try anything once.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Except sex.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yaa, I'm a dead poet!

turns.speaker: MEEKS
turns.text: Ahh!  Eat it, Dalton!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: This is it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Hey guys, why don't you show Tina the Dead Poets garden?

turns.speaker: MEEKS
turns.text: Garden?

turns.speaker: PITTS
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh come on, Pitts...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I hereby declare this the Charles Dalton Cave for Passionate Experimentation.  In the future, anyone wishing entry must have permission from me.

turns.speaker: PITTS
turns.text: Wait a minute, Charlie. This should belong to the club.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It should, but I found it and now I claim it.  carpe cavern, guys.  Seize the cave.

turns.speaker: PITTS
turns.text: Well, of course not.  It's just that... You could have warned us.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I thought I'd be spontaneous.  I mean, that's the point of this whole thing, isn't it?

turns.speaker: PITTS
turns.text: Oh God, it's over now!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Why? Nobody knows who we are.

turns.speaker: PITTS
turns.text: Don't you think they'll figure out who did it?!  Don't you know they'll come to you and demand to know what the Dead Poets Society is?   Charlie, you had no right to do something like that!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's Nuwanda, Cameron.

turns.speaker: PITTS
turns.text: Damn it, Nuwanda.  You idiot.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I couldn't stop myself.

turns.speaker: PITTS
turns.text: But what if they see it, Nuwanda?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So much the better.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I here and now commit myself to daring!

turns.speaker: KEATING
turns.text: So avoid using the word 'very' because it's lazy.  A man is not very tired, he is exhausted.  Don't use very sad, use morose.  Language was invented for one reason, boys--to woo women--and, in that endeavor, laziness will not do.  It also won't do in your essays.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Mr. Keating!

turns.speaker: KEATING
turns.text: I don't know what misguided impulse caused you to pull that ridiculous stunt, Mr. Dalton, but, whatever it was, I hope you've learned your lesson.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're siding with Mr. Nolan?!  What about carpe diem and sucking all the marrow out of life and all that?

turns.speaker: KEATING
turns.text: Sucking out the marrow doesn't mean getting the bone stuck in your throat, Charles.  You still have responsibilities to yourself and those who care about you.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: But I thought-

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yeah?  Like what?

turns.speaker: KEATING
turns.text: Like, if nothing else, the opportunity to attend my classes, understand?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: KEATING
turns.text: So keep your head about you--the lot of you--understood?

turns.speaker: KEATING
turns.text: Anything else you'd care to rifle through, Mr. Dalton?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I, we

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: It's such a strange name!  Won't you tell us what it means?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I told you, that's a secret.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Isn't he precious?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Yeah!    Don't you guys miss having girls here?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Miss it?  It drives us crazy.  That's part of what this club is about.  In fact, I'd like to announce that I've published an article in the school paper, in the name of the Dead Poets society, demanding girls be admitted to Welton, so we can all stop beating off.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: That's right, it's Nuwanda.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: And are we just playing around out here or do we mean what we say?  If all we do is come and read a bunch of poems to each other, what the hell are we doing?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I think he's sweet.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I think you're sweet.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: You know what really excites me about you?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Every guy that I meet wants me for one thing my body.  You're not like that.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm not?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: No!  Anybody else would have jumped my bones by now but you're after my soul. Make me up some more poetry.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Please!    It's so wonderful to be appreciated for my mind!

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Nuwanda?  Please?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: All right!  I'm thinking!  "Let me not to the marriage of true minds Admit impediments; love is not love Which alters when it alteration finds Or bends with the remover to remove."

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Don't stop.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: "O, no, it is an ever-fixed mark That looks on tempests and is never shaken; It is the star to every wandering bark whose worth's unknown, although his height be taken."

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: This is better than sex any day.  This is romance!

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: Welcome. back, Mr. Dalton.  How's your father?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Doing fine, sir.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: Your family move into that new house, Mr. Overstreet?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yes sir.  We were just talking about that.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: Good.  We're very excited about him.  He was a Rhodes Scholar, you know.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Welton Academy, hello?  Yes, he is, just a moment.  Mr. Nolan, it's for you.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: what?!

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: Who else was involved in this?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No one, sir.  It was just me.  I did the proofing so I inserted my article in place of Rob Crane's.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: Mr. Dalton, if you think you're the first to try to get thrown out of this school, think again.  Others have had similar actions and they have failed just as surely as you will fail.  Bend over and grab your shins.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: Do you still insist that this was your idea and your idea alone?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yes... sir.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: What is this "Dead Potts Society"?  I want names.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's only me, Mr. Nolan.  I swear. I made it up.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: If I find that there are others, Mr. Dalton, they will be expelled and you will remain enrolled.  Stand up.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Hey, I heard you went to summer school?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Yeah, chemistry.  My father thought I should get ahead.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well, Meeks aced Latin and I didn't quite flunk English so if you want, we've got our study group.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Sure, but Cameron asked me too.  Anybody mind including him?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What's his specialty, brown-nosing?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Hey, he's your roommate.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That's not my fault.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Todd's brother is Jeffrey Anderson.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh yeah.  Sure.  Valedictorian, National Merit Scholar

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Okay, so I don't like it any more than you do.  I'm just saying

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Then don't tell me how to talk to my father when you're the same way.  All right?!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I don't know about anyone else, but I could use a refresher in Latin.  Eight o'clock in my room?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're welcome to join us, Todd.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Who's in?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm in.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I went to the woods because I wanted to live deliberately."  I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life!"

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: All right.  I'll second that.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: To put the rout all that was not life.  And not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.  Pledge Overstreet.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Charlie, That was great!  Where did you learn to play like that?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: My parents made me take clarinet but I hated it.  The sax is more sonorous.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Charlie...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's Nuwanda.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Nuwanda, what is going on?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Nothing, unless you object to having girls here.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Where'd you find them?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: They were walking along the fence past the soccer field.  Said they were curious about the school so I invited them to the meeting.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You what?!  How did you do that?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm one of the proofers.  I slipped the article in.
